Detailed Description

template<typename T, boost::uint32_t size = 32u>
class circular_queue< T, size >

High-performance, thread-safe, cross-platform circular queue for producer/consumer threading models.

Queue operations:

  • push: you can add item to the end of a list
  • pop: you can remove first item from list and return it

Circular queue:

  • Cross-platform
  • High-performance
  • Thread-safe
  • Fair threading(oldest waiting thread first)
  • Low memory usage (lower then normal queue)
  • Without slow locks (mutex, semaphore)
  • Blocked queue (automatic empty/full queue handling)
  • Best for producer/consumer threading model

rules:

  • Use boost::thread, for cross-platform threading
  • Set disable_interruption() on all threads
  • You need to know/handle, how many items will be pushed

example: see circular_queue_example.cpp

Member Function Documentation

template<typename T , boost::uint32_t size = 32u>
int circular_queue< T, size >::getQueueLength ( ) [inline]

Gets the estimated length of the queue.

You can use this for checking when new data is availible, but only in single-threaded popping with popUnsafe(). When pop threads are waiting for data, it will be negative. When push threads are waiting in a full queue, it will be bigger then size.

template<typename T , boost::uint32_t size = 32u>
bool circular_queue< T, size >::pop ( T &  item) [inline]

Pop item from queue and return the popped item.

Thread-safe pop.

Parameters:
itemItem, where the popped item will be copied.
Returns:
True, when success. False, when queue is empty and signalNoMorePush() was called.
template<typename T , boost::uint32_t size = 32u>
T circular_queue< T, size >::pop ( ) [inline]

Pop item from queue and return the popped item.

Thread-safe pop. Will throw exNoMorePush exception, when queue is empty and signalNoMorePush() was called.

Returns:
The item popped.
template<typename T , boost::uint32_t size = 32u>
bool circular_queue< T, size >::popUnsafe ( T &  item) [inline]

Pop item from queue and return the popped item.

Use this, if you want to pop only from single thread, but push from multiple. (collect data)

Parameters:
itemItem, where the popped item will be copied.
Returns:
True, when success. False, when queue is empty and signalNoMorePush() was called.
template<typename T , boost::uint32_t size = 32u>
T circular_queue< T, size >::popUnsafe ( ) [inline]

Pop item from queue and return the popped item.

Use this, if you want to pop only from single thread, but push from multiple. (collect data) Will throw exNoMorePush exception, when queue is empty and signalNoMorePush() was called.

Returns:
The item popped.
template<typename T , boost::uint32_t size = 32u>
void circular_queue< T, size >::push ( const T &  item) [inline]

Push item to queue.

Thread-safe push.

Parameters:
itemThe item to push to the queue.
template<typename T , boost::uint32_t size = 32u>
void circular_queue< T, size >::pushUnsafe ( const T &  item) [inline]

Push item to queue without push thread-safety.

Use this for single-threaded pushing and multi-threaded popping. (add tasks for workers)

Parameters:
itemThe item to push to the queue.
template<typename T , boost::uint32_t size = 32u>
void circular_queue< T, size >::signalNoMorePush ( ) [inline]

Close the queue for pushing.

When you don't want to push any more data, you can call this, and all threads waiting for data will return.
